abstract: Story of Delaware salesman Toby Lopez, who spent 14 months in prison for his amateur Internet investigation into Islamic State's online activities, illustrates ambiguities around such cases; situation combines difficulty FBI officials face in dealing with overenthusiastic amateurs, murky and dangerous realms of Internet and what many see as alienating effects of criminal justice system.
lead_paragraph: Toby Lopez, a Delaware man, spent nearly 14 months in federal custody after he repeatedly reported online exchanges with people he believed to be terrorists.

headline.main: An Amateur vs. ISIS: A Car Salesman Investigates and Ends Up in Prison
headline.print_headline: Amateur vs. ISIS: An Online Sleuth Lands in Jail

snippet: Toby Lopez, a Delaware man, spent nearly 14 months in federal custody after he repeatedly reported online exchanges with people he believed to be terrorists.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
